intro: Podalyria cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf podalyria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features trifoliate leaves with a cuneate shape, giving it its specific epithet. Its small, pea-like flowers are typically purple or violet in color, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Podalyria cuneifolia is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates.
